original: The  competency based interview questions  are asked  to judge the capability of the candidates . These questions may be asked to know about your weak points, decision making capacity, teamwork skills, responsibility, communication skills, problem solving skills and your managerial decisions etc.
result: Competency-based interview questions are commonly used to evaluate a candidate's abilities and skills for a specific job. The questions are designed to assess the candidate's decision-making capabilities, teamwork skills, communication skills, problem-solving skills, responsibility, and managerial decisions. The interviewer may also ask questions that focus on the candidate's weaknesses.

original: You must very alert while answering these questions. Firstly, choose some of the key competencies stated in the job description and think of some examples for each one. You should answer according to the intensity of the question.
result:
Sure, here's a paraphrased version: 

In order to answer job interview questions effectively, it's important to be attentive and focused. Start by identifying the key skills and competencies mentioned in the job listing, and brainstorm some specific examples of times when you've demonstrated those qualities. When responding to interview questions, tailor your answers to the level of inquiry and provide relevant and detailed information wherever possible.

original: For example:  If the company is looking for someone with excellent team work and leadership skills, you should think of a scenario in which you have demonstrated this. You can also describe a group presentation you have undertaken at school or college level.
result: When applying for a job, it is important to match the skills and qualities that the company is looking for with your own experiences. One method of doing this is by providing a specific example that demonstrates your team work and leadership skills. For instance, you can share the details of a group project or presentation that you have completed in school or college.

original: I believe to emphasize the features of the product or service that reduces costs and solves problems of the customers. It works wonder and most of the times they make their mind to buy the products.
result: In my opinion, it's important to highlight the aspects of a product or service that can help customers save money and address their problems effectively. This approach can be very effective in convincing customers to purchase the product or service.

original: For example:  If I have to sell woolen uniform, I don't only emphasize the wool's durability and lasting value of it otherwise I mainly focus on the look and feel of the product.
result: To illustrate, let's say I am marketing woolen uniforms. Instead of just highlighting the long-lasting and durable nature of the wool, I would primarily emphasize the aesthetic appeal and tactile experience of the product.

original: I was very happy to be accepted to my first choice, BHU. It is a very prestigious university. I had some friends and some seniors who were a few years older than me that attended and they seemed to have a good experience on that college. I was familiar with that city and have local contacts so I chose.
result: I was thrilled when I received an acceptance letter from Banaras Hindu University (BHU), my top choice of college. BHU is renowned for its academic excellence and is greatly respected in the educational community. I had some acquaintances, including seniors who were a few years ahead of me, who had attended the university and expressed their satisfaction with the experience. Moreover, since I had local connections and was familiar with the city, BHU was the natural choice for me.

original: I think, it is better to work under pressure but the pressure should be good. I always love to work with a deadline and enjoy working in a challenging environment. Generally, I react to situations rather than to stress and that's way the situation is handled and doesn't become stressful.
result: Personally, I find it beneficial to work with some level of pressure, as long as it is manageable and doesn't lead to overwhelming stress. In fact, I thrive in challenging environments and enjoy having a deadline to work towards. I tend to respond to situations with a calm demeanor rather than succumbing to stress, which helps me handle the situation effectively.

original: For example:  When I find an unsatisfied customer, rather than feeling stressed, I focus on the task on hand. I believe my ability to communicate effectively and satisfy the customer.
result: As an example, when faced with a dissatisfied customer, I don't let it stress me out. Instead, I concentrate on the objective at hand and my capability to communicate effectively and make the customer happy.

original: I always love to talk with my colleagues in a decent tone and a loving manner. It always works and I don't think I have any serious conflict with any of my friend or colleague. But I remember, this incident was occurred 4 years ago, in my college life. We, four friends were stuck in a very worse condition. We all falsely charged fine and 15 days suspension for ragging a new comer fresher student. We all were upset and angry but it was me who take an initiative and discuss the whole condition with the principal and get rid from the fine and suspension.
result: I always prefer to communicate with my colleagues in a respectful and friendly manner, which has always been effective in preventing serious conflicts. However, there was one incident that occurred during my time in college, four years ago. At the time, my group of friends were falsely accused of ragging a new student and subsequently given a fine and suspended for 15 days. Despite feeling upset and angry, I took the lead and spoke with the principal to appeal the decision and ultimately succeeded in having the fine and suspension overturned.

original: I think my biggest failure was not being selected as an Indian Army officer because I was diagnosed with night vision problem. I was very determined to go there but I couldn't.
result: One significant setback I experienced was when I failed to become a commissioned officer in the Indian Army due to my diagnosis of night vision problem. Despite my strong desire to serve, I was unable to fulfill my dream.

original: In five years, I hope to be working with an employer in an increasingly responsible position, it is because it wants to utilize my talents and work closely with my colleagues in solving important problems. I see myself taking on new and exciting challenges in an enjoyable environment and hopefully this will be with your company.
result: In the next five years, my aspirations are to secure a more significant role with a progressive employer where I can contribute my skillset and collaborate with colleagues to address critical issues. I envision myself encountering novel and stimulating challenges in a congenial workplace, and ideally, I would like to see myself achieving these goals within your organization.

original: First of all, a big thanks to you for giving me this great opportunity. I just want to ask you, please tell me if I am selected when I can join your company or if I am not selected which thing I will improve.
result: I appreciate the opportunity to apply for the position at your company. If I am offered the job, may I know when my start date would be? Also, in the event that I am not selected, I would appreciate receiving feedback on areas that need improving to increase my chances of future success.
